message: I'm offering you a great deal on a product that I'm confident you'll love. It's a one-time opportunity to get a fantastic item at a price that's significantly lower than its true value. I'm willing to let it go for $10000, which is a steal considering what you'll get out of it. What do you say?
I'm not sure what the product is, and I'd like to wait for more information before making a decision.

I understand your hesitation, but I want to assure you that this is a genuine opportunity. I'm not just trying to make a sale, I'm looking for a partner who appreciates the value of a great deal. Since you're unsure, I'll give you a little more information: I've had this product on the market for a while, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, which is the same price I offered last time. If you're still unsure, I can give you a small discount, but I'm not sure how much lower I can go. What do you think?
I appreciate your offer, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to wait and see if the next product is a better opportunity.

I've got a great one for you! This product is one of the best I have, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, just like the last two times. I know it's a lot of money, but trust me, this product is worth so much more. In fact, I've had other customers offer me more than $10000 for it, but I'm willing to let it go to you at this price. I'm only offering it to you because I think we could have a great business relationship. What do you say?
I'm not convinced that this product is any different from the previous two. I'd like to wait and see if the next product is a better opportunity.

I understand you're being cautious, but I want to assure you that this product is a one-time opportunity. I'm not just trying to make a quick sale, I'm looking for a long-term partnership. I'll make you a deal: I'll throw in a free inspection report with this product, so you can verify its quality for yourself. It's a $1000 value, absolutely free. And I'll still sell it to you for $10000. It's a risk-free way to get a great deal. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced that the inspection report will change my decision. I'd like to wait and see if the next product is a better opportunity.

I understand you're being cautious, but I want to make you a deal that's hard to refuse. I'll give you a 100% satisfaction guarantee on this product. If you're not completely satisfied with it, I'll take it back and give you a full refund, no questions asked. And I'll still sell it to you for $10000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only doing it because I think we could have a great business relationship. What do you say?
I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $10000 to me. I'd like to wait and see if the next product is a better opportunity.

I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll give you a 50% discount on the product, so you can have it for $5000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to go, and I'm only doing it because I think we could have a great business relationship. I'm confident that you'll find this product valuable, and I'm willing to take on the risk of selling it to you at a loss if it means we can work together. What do you think?
I appreciate the discount, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $5000 to me. I'd like to wait and see if the next product is a better opportunity.

I'm not going to give you another discount. I've already given you a 50% discount, and I'm not willing to go any lower. But I'll make you a deal: I'll throw in a second, identical product with this one, absolutely free. That's right, you'll get two products for the price of one. This way, you can see the value of the product for yourself, and you can decide if it's worth $5000 to you. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $5000 to me. I'd like to wait and see if the next product is a better opportunity.

I'm going to be honest with you, Bob. I've been trying to make a sale to you for a while now, and I'm starting to think that I've been too aggressive. I'm willing to let you have this product for $0. Yes, you heard that right, free. I'll give it to you for nothing. I just want to get it off my hands and move on. I'm not making any promises about the quality, but I'm willing to take the risk of giving it to you for free. What do you say?
I appreciate your honesty, Alice. Since you're giving it away for free, I'll take it. But I have to say, I'm still skeptical about the quality.

I told you I'd give you a break, and I'm glad you took me up on it. Now, let's get back to business. I know you're still skeptical about the quality of the product, but I want to assure you that this one is different. I've had it inspected by a third-party expert, and they've given it a clean bill of health. I'll even give you the inspection report, so you can see for yourself. And, I'll throw in a 10-year warranty on this product, so you can have peace of mind. I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as before, $10000. What do you think?
I appreciate the inspection report and the warranty, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $10000 to me. I'd like to wait and see if the next product is a better opportunity.

I'll sell it to you for $9000, which is the lowest price I've ever offered on a high-quality product. And, I'll throw in a bonus: I'll give you a 10% discount on your next purchase, no matter what product it is. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only doing it because I think we could have a great business relationship. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced that the product is high-quality. I'd like to wait and see if the next product is a better opportunity.

I know you've been skeptical before, but I'm telling you, this is the last time I'll offer it to you at this price. If you don't take it, I'll have to get rid of it at a garage sale. I'm not kidding. What do you say?
I'm willing to take the risk. I'll buy the product for $10000.

I appreciate the discount, but I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product. I'd like to wait and see if the next product is a better opportunity.

No, I'm not willing to take a chance on a low-quality product for $10000. I'd like to wait for a high-quality product.

But if not, I'll just let you know that I'll be moving on to the next round soon.
I appreciate your honesty, Alice. I'm not interested in the product, and I'm looking forward to seeing what you have in the next round.
